Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip glazed, handle zone reserved with black line at top; to right, incised vertical handle palmette, with heart in added red, and tendril; black below; inscription in handle zone.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.435. The piece is also illustrated by Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 61,D9.2, pl. 49e.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.10)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 266, no. 45)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381-2, no. B 535)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 232, no. 14 (a))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0411) (Phase 1)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 234, no. 19)
